security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation with commit message conventions. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access. Contains example git commands in documentation blocks only.

content.user_title: Create commit messages with Sentry conventions
content.value_statement: Writing clear, consistent commit messages helps teams understand code changes and track issues. This skill generates standardized commit messages following conventional commits format with Sentry-specific issue references and formatting rules.
actual_capabilities: Generate commit messages using conventional commits format with type, scope, and subject
Apply Sentry-specific issue reference patterns (SENTRY-, GH-, # prefixes)
Format body text with imperative mood explaining what and why
Create breaking change notices with proper footer annotations
limitations: Does not execute git commands or create actual commits
Does not access git repository state or history
Does not validate commit messages against remote branch policies
Does not integrate with CI/CD systems for commit validation

use_cases.title: Standardize team commit history
use_cases.description: Generate consistent, readable commit messages that improve code review and changelog generation.

use_cases.title: Follow project conventions
use_cases.description: Create commits that match Sentry project guidelines for smooth PR integration.

use_cases.title: Maintain clean git history
use_cases.description: Apply consistent message formats that work with automated versioning and release tools.

prompt_templates.title: Simple fix
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a commit message for a bug fix that handles null response in the user API, references SENTRY-5678

prompt_templates.title: Feature with scope
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a commit message for adding Slack thread replies to alerts, scope is alerts, reference GH-1234

prompt_templates.title: Breaking change
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a commit message for removing deprecated v1 API endpoints, include breaking change footer, reference SENTRY-9999

prompt_templates.title: Refactor only
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a refactor commit message for extracting validation logic to a shared module, no behavior change

output_examples.input: Create a commit message for fixing a null pointer error in the user endpoint, reference SENTRY-5678
output: fix(api): Handle null response in user endpoint
The user API could return null for deleted accounts, causing a crash
in the dashboard. Add null check before accessing user properties.

best_practices: Keep subject lines under 70 characters with no trailing period
Explain what changed and why, not how the change was implemented
Always reference issues using Fixes or Refs prefixes for traceability
anti_patterns: Using past tense in subject lines (Fixed vs Fix)
Exceeding 100 characters on any line in the message
Including implementation details or code snippets in commit messages

faq.question: Does this skill execute git commands?
faq.answer: No. This skill generates commit message text following conventions. Users must execute git commands themselves.

faq.question: What commit types are supported?
faq.answer: feat, fix, ref, perf, docs, test, build, ci, chore, style, meta, license, and revert.

faq.question: How does it handle issue references?
faq.answer: It supports multiple formats: GH-1234, #1234, SENTRY-1234 for Fixes and Refs footers.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a prompt-only skill with no code execution, network access, or filesystem operations.

faq.question: Can I use this with other AI assistants?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code as it provides plain text guidelines.

faq.question: How is this different from other commit tools?
faq.answer: This skill follows Sentry-specific conventions including branch naming, issue formats, and commit type rules.
